recipe.name: Buttermilk Biscuits, Tyler Florence
recipe.notes: I find Food TV's Tyler Florence kind of disgusting for some reason -- its a personality thing.  His food always seems kind of intersting and it would be worth doing a recipe shotout with another batch.  This breaks biscuit flour down for us a ways, which is nice and marginally better for us.
recipe.preparation: In a large bowl mix together flour, salt, baking poder and baking soda.  Cut in the shortening until the mixture forms coarse crumbs.  Make a well and add 1 cup buttermilk.  Quickly cut dry ingredients into the buttermilk to form a sticky dough.  Add more buttermilk as necesary.Turn out the dough on a floured surfaceand foldover itself 3-4 times.   Press out to 1 1/2 inches thick and section with a 3-inch cutter.  Arrange biscuis on an ungreased cooke sheet and brush with buttermilk before baking 20-25 minutes or until risen and golden at 375F.
